body: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SJHyuKr55TMSM9DZtmA-ax1qviaZYl7mTdi1aozEczsRa-oZHTVu4YK6S5yS6z5QVI0kCUuZXhdNe7eOIoHehVdOCCfFUykj/Capture.PNG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SJHyuKr55TMSM9DZtmA-ax1qviaZYl7mTdi1aozEczsRa-oZHTVu4YK6S5yS6z5QVI0kCUuZXhdNe7eOIoHehVdOCCfFUykj/Capture.PNG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SJHyuKr55TMSM9DZtmA-ax1qviaZYl7mTdi1aozEczsRa-oZHTVu4YK6S5yS6z5QVI0kCUuZXhdNe7eOIoHehVdOCCfFUykj/Capture.PNG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SJHyuKr55TMSM9DZtmA-ax1qviaZYl7mTdi1aozEczsRa-oZHTVu4YK6S5yS6z5QVI0kCUuZXhdNe7eOIoHehVdOCCfFUykj/Capture.PNG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SJHyuKr55TMSM9DZtmA-ax1qviaZYl7mTdi1aozEczsRa-oZHTVu4YK6S5yS6z5QVI0kCUuZXhdNe7eOIoHehVdOCCfFUykj/Capture.PNG) Hi,  I am using Honeybee/Daysim to run an annual daylight simulation with a dynamic blind system. I have read that there are two methods to set the blinds schedules: - 1. When there are 50w/m2 on the window - 2. When there is more than 40% of the interior sensors that surpasses a certain illuminance threshold.  I think I figured out how to do the second option (see picures below) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SJHyuKr55TPLOgPrWy4QcN9ME0OM9BSmtuUV4PvDfZmshaNIJc85QJmsQD5LzwOm-Lb0Qtg4D3rpXGybzSputR1*FQl6X1gR/Capture2.PNG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/SJHyuKr55TMdToWwwj9MX4lryTYkrArKkfbSpjun1gKgIsJi-wBdZtVTdyvjtvpRkWUcakjxpk7xp5V4DuOByTgjJw8RdLum/Capture.PNG) But what about the first one? how can I set the exterior sensor to check for the 50W/m2 on the window? Thanks in advance, Alejandro
topic: Set the shading schedule with Daysim/Honeybee
